creator: cristian.fogel@softvision.ro
summary: Bookmark context menu open from right-click on bottom of bookmark sidebar or library

assigned_to_detail.name: nobody@mozilla.org
assigned_to_detail.real_name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

comments.text:
Created attachment 8982211
bookmarks context menu.png

[Affected versions]:
- Firefox 60.0.1, Firefox 61.0b9, Firefox 62.0a1 (2018-05-29)

[Affected platforms]:
Windows 10x64, Ubuntu 16.04, MacOS 10.13.4

[Steps to reproduce]:
1. Launch Firefox;
2. Add at least one bookmark; 
3. Open the Bookmark sidebar section;
4. Expand the bookmark lists;
5. Click on any bookmark;
6. Right-click on the background-section from bellow "Other bookmarks".

[Expected result]:
- Nothing happens.

[Actual result]:
- Context menu form last selected bookmark is opened.

[Regression range]:
- Not a regression.

[Additional notes]:
- attached screenshot with the issue;
- if nothing is selected right-clicking does nothing, which seems ok.
comments.author: cristian.fogel@softvision.ro

comments.text: Pretty sure this is a dupe, or if not related to some other bugs around the bottom area of the library/sidebar windows that we have.
comments.author: standard8@mozilla.com

comments.text: That was my first thought as well, but was unable to find anything related at the point this issue was logged.
comments.author: cristian.fogel@softvision.ro

changes.removed: Bookmark context menu open from right-click on bookmark sidebar background
changes.added: Bookmark context menu open from right-click on bottom of bookmark sidebaror library
